entry.title: Combined summary - [QT] Feature proposal: Displaying current Units/Changing Units with status bar control.
entry.summary: The context of this email exchange is around the default unit of display for Bitcoin transactions, with debate over whether it should be BTC or mBTC. Angel Leon proposes the idea of a status bar component that would show the current unit of display and allow users to easily change it. The dropdown menu for changing the unit of display would be a common part of the layout, but a slight optimization suggested was to also include the unit in the transaction table header so that users don't have to think about the unit of their values. In a conversation between Angel Leon and Wladimir, they discuss the potential benefits of adding a global setting in the status bar for Bitcoin. Wladimir suggests adding a [unit] in the table header and notes that it may make it more apparent to the user that multiple units can be selected. Angel shares an update regarding the addition of features to the project which includes showing the current unit on the header column title "Amount ($unitHere)" and adding a confirmation dialog to prevent users from changing the current unit of display by mistake. Gregory Maxwell suggests that if a global setting is added in the status bar, it should be done in a way where it's impossible for a stray keypress to switch it.There has been a debate over the default unit of display to use for Bitcoin transactions, and regular users may have trouble finding a way to change the current unit of display. Therefore, having a status bar component that shows the current unit of display and allows easy changing could be beneficial. The proposed component would show the current unit of display at all times and allow users to easily change it. Feedback is being requested before submitting a pull request to polish the component.
